headline: Caramel Shortbread Squares
description: This recipe for caramel squares (millionaire's shortbread) features three layers of utter decadence: shortbread, caramel, and milk chocolate.

video.description: See how to make classic scalloped potatoes without cheese.
video.name: Caramel Shortbread Squares

name: Caramel Shortbread Squares

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 C).
Make the shortbread: Mix flour, softened butter, and sugar together in a medium bowl until well blended and crumbly. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch square baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until dry and light golden brown, about 20 minutes.

Make the caramel: Bring butter, brown sugar, condensed milk, and corn syrup to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat. Boil for 5 minutes, then remove from the heat and beat vigorously with a wooden spoon for about 3 minutes. Pour over baked crust (crust can be either warm or cool). Let sit at room temperature until caramel begins to firm up, 2 to 3 hours.
Microwave chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl on high for 1 minute, then stir and continue to heat and stir in 20-second intervals until chocolate is melted and smooth.
Pour chocolate over caramel layer and spread evenly to cover completely. Chill in the refrigerator until chocolate is set, about 30 minutes. Cut into 1-inch squares.

review.reviewBody: I'm a cook, but I'm not a baker, so I was certain I'd screw these up, but thankfully everything turned out WONDERFULLY. I read through the reviews to get a sense of where people commonly had issues, and the changes I made were that I buttered the pan prior to adding the shortbread, by doing this it prevented everything from sticking to the pan (some people used parchment paper). I cooked the caramel on lower medium heat and started by melting the butter first, then adding the rest of the wet ingredients together and then the brown sugar last, I stirred constantly with a whisk or spoon and kept my heat at medium low, I never quit stirring until I was pouring the caramel on top of the shortbread, and it turned out absolutely perfectly. I melted the chocolate in a hot water bath (heated water in a bowl and then submerged a pyrex measuring cup with the chocolate chips in it into the bowl so they'd melt inside of the measuring cup from the heat the water provides through the glass) and they melted within a couple of minutes with some stirring. I also used coarsely ground Himalayan salt on top of the chocolate before I let it cool - it's a fabulous addition, and I highly recommend, it's a perfect salty compliment to the sweetness. I used a knife heated with warm water to cut my squares and it went smoothly as long as I kept the knife warmed. I stored everything in a plastic Tupperware so the shortbread softened quite a bit, and now I have a huge container of these decadent sweets to enjoy through New Years! I'm saving this recipe and I will make it again and again, and I recommend you give it a try if you're thinking about it and these sound good. You can do it!! I bet finely chopped walnuts would be a good topping too, maybe even in addition with the coarse salt.
Just made these & they were great! The only thing is I turn the heat down during boiling caramel & I used the double boiler method melting chocolate instead of the microwave . Otherwise ??????????
Amazing my class loved it!

It took way longer than 20 minutes with all the cooling in between. But still easy and good. I used less sugar and didn’t have corn syrup so subbed agave syrup and honey for the caramel layer. Also used a whole bar of dark chocolate melted over stovetop. Would’ve liked some salt in the shortbread or on top.
It was awsome
Delicious! I'll definitely make these again.

I made this exactly as written. I didn't have a square 9x9 pan so I used two 10x4 inch pans but it ended up being the same overall dimensions. Having worked with shortbread before I knew to put down parchment paper which is a life saver and keeps it from sticking to the pan. I cooled the shortbread for about 20 minutes and then the finished bars for about 45 minutes or so. Overall this is a good recipe and I think I will put some sea salt on top when I make it again. Be careful when making the chocolate because it doesn't take much to overcook it. 1 minute 40 seconds should be enough time.

These are delicious! every time I make them for anyone, they are a huge hit. I prefer to use dark chocolate in everything that need chocolate, so that is my only change. Every part of this is delicious, the shortbread, the Carmel, thanks for sharing!!
I didn't have a big enough tray or enough chocolate. I also didn't have condensed milk. I made my own condensed milk!
Absolutely delicious!

These are disgustingly sweet. I kid u not. I doubled the recipe (used 9x13). Shortbread took 30 mins or so in oven. It will be 'soft' when you take it out of oven (don't worry, it will firm up as it cools). Loved em but too rich - the milk choc on top should be semi-sweet or dark or mix as many others have pointed out. They're great, but seriously I probably have 100 cavities now after having a few. Great recipe!
I will make it again!
I would submit tie intervals of how long until you pour the chocolate
This recipe is CRAZY FABULOUS!!!!!
Delicious. Instead of corn syrup, I used fancy molasses. Very sweet, cutting to 1" squares is a great suggestion.
Shortbread seriously lacked flavor.

I followed the recipe, right down to cutting them into 1" squares. My family and I enjoyed these squares and I will definitely make them again. The squares were the perfect size with a cup of tea after enjoying dinner.
These are wonderful! I was a little nervous making the caramel but it was easy! Everyone thought they tasted like a Twix candy bar
cool
I am making this again today. It just went so fast!! Super tasty!!!!
Love these! Easy and fairly fast to make!
Turned out well. Thanks.
The best.
Only changed the measurements from lbs and ounces to cups. I got this recipe from a friend who got it from an English magazine. She gave it to me 40 years ago.
Love it!! My favorite Christmas dessert!! One thing that you must do is to triple this. Thanks

So fun to make. Probably because I made successfully the first time. 
Tim rules.
I use caramel and melt them over a double boiler rather tan trying to make my own.
These are amazing!! I didn’t change a thing, they came out perfect. A family hit.
It was absolutely delicious!!
The caramel turned out hard
Delicious!! I think this will be my new go to dessert for taking to parties!
Mine didn't come out quite as pretty as the ones in the picture, but no one seemed to mind! Next time I'll let the caramel cool completely before adding the chocolate
It was easy and it tastes amazing

These are one of my favorite go to cookies for luncheons or parties or just to share. They are easy and look nice on a platter. They are like a home Twix bar. I use this caramel recipe for nearly all my recipes that call for caramel. No need to purchase caramel squares to melt when you have this recipe. I always keep a can or two of sweetened condensed milk on hand and use the entire can for this recipe. I don't bother to measure out 1/2 cup. It's likely more than a half cup, but it turns out perfect.
Delicious...

Caramel was perfect! For those that thought the caramel was too thin on the shortbread for the 13 x 9 pan just 3x the recipe for the caramel and you will have a lovely layer of caramel. The crust was wonderful as was the chocolate top. Be sure to take the time to cool each layer as recommended. Otherwise you will have the chocolate and the caramel running together. Huge hit with the family. Definitely worth the effort!
I love the shortbread. I would suggest to double boil the chocolate. When I microwaved the chocolate, it didn't melt. It turned to clay.
These are HEAVENLY! But, you must be patient and take your time with the caramel otherwise it'll burn. I stir constantly before I bring it to a boil. They are well worth the effort!!
All the components are delicious but, as written, the shortbread is too crumbly and the caramel is too stiff to eat it successfully or to cut into one inch squares. It really ruins the experience.
Wonderful. This is a very delicious recipe, a lot easier than it looks!
Followed the recipe to a tee and it came out DELICIOUS. It is very rich and sweet, so I would say about 40 servings is appropriate. Eat sparingly!!

This is Bakery Chef type desert but homemade. So easy to make to get a decadent dessert. I will try semi sweet chocolate chips next time. 
I had only one issue in the beginning when cooking the caramel sauce. The sauce started to boil at medium heat then it began to get dark brown spots in it. I turned down the heat to low kept stirring and the dark spots incorporated back into the sauce. The sauce still boiled at low and I took it off at 5 minutes as instructed. It tasted great. My son who doesn't usually likes real sweet desserts liked this because of the crunchy shortbread.
Suggestion for getting the best results. Cool the shortbread completely before pouring the caramel on it, then let cool on counter (allows caramel to stiffen up) before adding chocolate topping. Use an off set spatula to spread chocolate onto caramel. Then cool the whole dessert in pan in fridge before cutting. Use a sharp knife. Put cut squares in plastic container keep in fridge till 45 minutes before serving. Seems correct the crumbly crust when first baked.

Don't know what I did but my caramel never set and the chocolate layer just sat on top, not attached. The caramel looked like soft caramel. When I tried to cut it, the chocolate cracked every which way. Shortbread was good though. Bummer....I admit, making caramel is hard for me (even though I'm a fairly experienced baker), but this seemed so easy from the reviews.

I had never made caramel before, so I didn't know: you must stir over low heat. I had it on high the first time I tried this, and my caramel was rock solid.

Once I got the hang of the caramel, this recipe made amazing cookies. I second the recommendation to use dark chocolate - it really balances the sweetness of the rest of the cookie beautifully.

These were excellent. I used dark chocolate instead of milk chocolate on the top. 

The description makes it sound as it they take 20 minutes but from beginning to end, it was over an hour; making the caramel took the majority of that time. It seemed that keeping the heat at medium at first, then down to medium-low after the caramel started to boil worked out best on my stove.

I made these and they were INCREDIBLE. I doubled the recipe and made two batches. I followed the various suggestions and chilled between layers. The first batch I went by the recipe completely, the second batch, I used sweetened condensed coconut milk and a mixture of milk and dark chocolate. The second batch had a nice added coconut flavor, though the caramel took longer to set up. I melted the chocolate with a little half and half (about 1/4 cup) as recommended.

A note, when making the caramel, first melt and heat the milk before adding the sugar. Some of the sugar burned at the bottom of the pot first time around.

Definitely a keeper!
taste like Twix bars....and yes cut small they are very rich.

Will not make again, followed recipe exactly, first caramel layer burned, second one did not set up properly. Lots of money wasted on ingredients. Not worth time or money. Printed recipe did not state medium heat nor stir constantly while boiling for 5 minutes, I turned gas stove down to low and first batch still burned. Very disappointed.
Very good, family loved them.
i helped make it for a culinary treat it worked well
Yes to makeing it again.

This recipe was very easy and got rave reviews at a party. The best was from my brother-in-law, who said "I think these are what Jesus serves people in heaven." Making them again for Thanksgiving family get together.

Overall the recipe turned out well. One thing that we would change is that we would make the shortbread layer thicker. We would do this so that you could taste that part better. Another thing that we would do is make the chocolate layer smaller so that the chocolate flavor is not as overpowering.
My family loved it! Its quick and yummy !
The shortbread did not stick together and the carmel was too hard. I double checked the ingredient portions and made sure I timed the boiling and stirring of the carmel.
A little disappointed in these. The best part of it was the caramel, the shortbread really didn't have any flavor.
I thought these were very good but my husband felt the shortbread part was dry. I made them for a group along with 2 other kinds of cookies and these were the first ones to be eaten.

My daughter just loves caramel so I had to try this recipe. After reading the reviews that said the milk chocolate chips made everything too sweet I used semi sweet chips instead and regretted it! Next time I will definitely use milk chocolate chips!!!

This was really good. I used a slightly smaller pan for this recipe. I used around 170g of chocolate (milk and dark), which was a good amount. I think the caramel was a bit too sweet, and there was around double the caramel compared to the rest of the layers, so I might make that a bit smaller next time. Overall it was amazing and it turned out really well!
This was AWESOME!!!! Everyone that I gave it to loved it, and I will definitely make it again.

I made it doubled and exactly how previous reviewers suggested. I made part with milk chocolate and another with the dark as was suggested. I liked the dark better which is unusual for me. I had no problems with any part of the recipe. It turned out fine but I just didn't think it was that great

These are amazing! I cooked my shortbread for an extra 5 minutes to make sure it was crisp. Definitely be careful of burning the caramel, but homemade caramel is the wa to go! My husband thinks the cookie layer could've been thinner, maybe next time I make it. Will definitely make these again! They were a hit at bunco!

I made this for the first time last week and it was amazing! I added a touch of salt to the caramel mixture which worked nicely. I also doubled it and made it in a 9 x 13 glass pan. It disappeared quickly, will make often!
I made this and my middle layer was not soft and chewy but toffee like. The bottom layer didn’t have much flavor and in the end I threw away the whole pan. Seriously disappointed.
came out incredible. though the video recipe is slightly different than what's printed - just beware/note. You will love it and so will your guest!
I made it but I had to cook the short bread crust for an additional 10 minutes It tasted great!
Very good! As mentioned by other reviewers use low heat and stir continually while making the caramel and it will come out perfectly. Enjoy!
Will make again and again.
I somehow overcooked the caramel layer and it started setting before I could get it spread around. When it cooled, it was impossible to cut into it. Sure looked good though.
I followed recipe as written. Turned out awesome, so chewy and delish. Entire family enjoyed them. Definitely will be making it again soon.

I made this twice, and the second time I added 1/4 teaspoon salt to the caramel sauce and it helped balance out the sweetness and gave it the salted caramel flavor I love. I also sprayed the pan first with Pam, but next time I will lay down Parchment first. Don’t try to cut it fresh out of the fridge - the chocolate will crack.

okay so I see plenty of people burned their caramel mixture once it comes to a boil turn it to medium low or low it will still boil number 2 I used cream instead of sweetened condensed milk And added it after the 5-minute boiling. Then I'd beat it vigorously with a wooden spoon put it back on the heat and boil for another 5 minutes at that point you will have a true stick to the spoon caramel mixture number 3 for me the chocolate coating on top was way too much and I prefer dark chocolate so I melted dark chocolate put it in a baggie and put pretty drizzles across the top. I also used some flaked pink Himalayan sea salt and gently sprinkled it over the top Sublime!

Great Recipe!! Loved the taste. Definitely prepare the caramel as directed, but on low. Takes a bit longer, but it's worth it. I'll 
 be sending these out for Christmas Boxes for my Family.

Delicious. Made double recipe in a 13x9 pan. Read other reviews so chilled each layer before adding the next. Pierced the shortbread with a fork before cooling. Stirred the caramel constantly and added sea salt to the top of the cara,

This was super delicious. I made a lot of the tweaks recommended in the comments (low and slow for heating the caramel, dark chocolate instead of milk, etc). I also added a generous dash of salt to the caramel - not enough to make it a "salted caramel" or anything, just enough to balance out the sweetness. It was a bit nondescript the first time I made it. Just about 1/4 tsp of sea salt seemed to make the caramel stand out more.

These are a huge hit with hubby and co-workers. When making the caramel, make sure you have it on low heat and stir constantly. My first batch of caramel burned slightly, but was still usable. It seemed I didn't really have enough caramel to cover so I made another batch and discovered that I had only put in 1/4 cup brown sugar instead of 1/2 cup (oops). Did the second batch low and slow (with the right amount of sugar LOL) and had no issues. Will definitely make again, and again.

TIP for caramel center: this is very similar to making candy. The hotter and longer you boil, the harder your center. If you want something softer, reduce the boiling time.
This was a big hit at my house. I'll have to brush up on my shortbread skills though as that was the only part I believe needing adjusting.

I made these for a luncheon with the ladies in my family and they were a big hit. I will definitely make them again. They are easy and delicious!! 

I followed some of the tips given by another review and have one of my own to share. We used parchment paper to line the pan, cooked the caramel on low heat and stirred constantly, and added a tablespoon of butter to the chocolate chips (these were all tips suggested in another review.) 

My suggestion: I added some sea salt on the top of the chocolate layer to cut the sweetness a bit and it added a wonderful layer of flavor. You don't need a lot. 

Give it a try and enjoy!
They were very tasty but didn't go over big at a weekend at the cabin with guests. Not sure I would make again.

They are delicious and rich! Giving it 4 stars because the prep took longer than 35 minutes for me. Took other reviewers advice and froze the shortbread after it cooled. The caramel took a while to boil because I left it on low heat so I did not scorch it. After I put the caramel layer on, I put it in the fridge to chill for maybe 30-40 minutes before putting the chocolate layer on top. You need to work fast spreading on the caramel layer else it will start to harden. I greased and floured the pan as another reviewer suggested. I used a plastic knife to go around the edges of the pan (I used a non-stick pan) , turned the pan upside down and the contents popped out. I then put it on a cutting board to cut into small squares. Took some time to make but the result was worth it.
This was fun to make and one of my family's favorite holiday deserts!!
Absolutely delicious!! Tastes very similar to a Twix Bar. VERY rich; so cut into small bars!
I love to bake and these might be the best bars I have ever made!
These won't last long in this house! I made the recipe exactly as stated and they came out perfect.

This was a really tasty dessert - super rich! The only reason I am giving 4 stars is that it was not "quick and easy". You really need a couple of hours at a minimum for everything to set properly - and the caramel layer is a bit time-consuming in order to avoid burning. I cooked on low heat and constantly stirred so had no problem. I did use dark chocolate instead of milk for better balance of flavors. These are really good and worth making but just take a bit more time and attention than something I consider quick and easy.

This was very easy to make although I did need to add a little butter to the topping so it would spread easier. However, we didn't think the taste was that good at all--way too bland. And the layers kept separating making them a little hard to eat. Will not make again--sorry!
These are great. Make sure to cook and beat the caramel mixture the recommended time or in won't set up. They are rich so cut small.

Idk what happened. It was firm on the outside but when I cut into it the caramel just oozed out! I'm sure you're wondering why I'm giving four stars then. Even though it was a mess It was SO DELICIOUS!!! If I make this again I will try to take the advice from the reviews! Thank you!

This is a little time consuming, but worth the effort. They are absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe exactly as written. The first time I did it, I was rushed and cutting them was a nightmare. These are worth planning ahead for!
I would cut back on the chocolate. But nobody else who tried it would agree.

These were very good. I doubled the recipe and used a 9x13 pan. In the future I will adjust the shortbread portion to fit the pan size. Too much shortbread when this is also doubled. I should have known better!
I added chopped peanuts to the caramel mixture. If you like nuts, it's great

These are really sweet, little rich butter bombs! Could reduce sugar amount... Cut them small! I made the mistake of cutting one recipe into 16 pieces, which were way too big. Could've halved that amount... came out of my silicone pan just fine or line with parchment. Cut after cooling.
I made it without the chocolate layer and it was very well received.
OMG.....Excellent, will have it again
Oh my goodness - these were AWESOME!!!!! Took them to a neighborhood gathering and they were gone in minutes. Easy to make, easier to eat :)!!!
These were pretty good... Although pretty sweet... But that's me. Other wise they were so good!
I could eat the entire thing in one sitting. Delicious!
Delicious and really rich. I used a good quality chocolate and it definitely improved the flavor
